key_points: Tiger Woods was involved in a serious car accident outside Los Angeles on February 23, 2021.
He was not intoxicated but was reportedly speeding at the time of the crash.
The accident resulted in serious injuries for Woods, including open and comminuted fractures of the tibia and fibula.
Woods underwent emergency surgery, with rods, pins, and screws inserted into his legs.
He has escaped death but faces concerns over the future of his golfing career.
Woods is considered one of the greatest golf players of his generation with significant achievements.
He had already placed his professional career on hold after a fifth spinal surgery in December 2020.
In a statement, Woods thanked medical professionals and assured fans he is recovering and working on getting stronger.
Former PGA Tour player Bill Mallon expressed optimism for Woods' return to professional golf within a year.
The accident highlights the importance of vehicular safety and the impact of injuries on sporting careers.
